intro: Siphonacanthus densus, commonly known as the dense-siphon acanthus, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins and serrated edges. Its flowers are typically clustered in whorls, with tubular corollas that are often brightly colored. Siphonacanthus densus is native to tropical regions and thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
